SPLIT BASS, DRUMS & VOCAL TRACKS.
DESIGN AUDIO NEURAL NETWORKS.
TRAIN & EVALUATE.

Introducing Auralflow — a lightweight deep learning toolkit for designing and training music source separation models with minimal code.

$ pip install auralflow
CORE FEATURES
POWERFUL ML ARCHITECTURES

Harness Versatile Deep Mask Autoencoders.

Customize the ins and outs of modifiable U-Nets — including LSTM networks and variational autoencoders — that learn time-frequency masks in the spectrogram domain.

Read About Models  

  • As a Model Wrapper
  • As a PyTorch Module
                                        from auralflow.utils import load_config
                                            from auralflow.models import SpectrogramMaskModel
                                            import torch


                                            # unload configuration data
                                            config_data = load_config("/path/to/my_model/config.json")

                                            # instantiate deep mask estimator
                                            mask_model = SpectrogramMaskModel(config_data)

                                            # generate 2 sec audio sample
                                            mix_audio = torch.rand((1, 88200))

                                            # extract vocals
                                            vocals_estimate = mask_model.separate(mix_audio)
                                    
                                        from auralflow.models import SpectrogramNetVAE
                                            # initialize network
                                            mask_model = SpectrogramNetVAE(
                                                    num_fft_bins=1024,
                                                    num_frames=173,
                                                    hidden_channels=16,
                                                    recurrent_depth=2,
                                                    hidden_size=2048
                                            )

                                            # generate spectrogram data
                                            mix_spec = torch.rand((8, 1, 1024, 173))

                                            # estimate source mask
                                            source_mask = mask_model(mix_spec)
  • example 1
  • example 2
                                        from auralflow.utils import load_config
                                            from auralflow.models import SpectrogramMaskModel
                                            import torch


                                            # unload configuration data
                                            config_data = load_config("/path/to/my_model/config.json")

                                            # instantiate deep mask estimator
                                            mask_model = SpectrogramMaskModel(config_data)

                                            # generate 2 sec audio sample
                                            mix_audio = torch.rand((1, 88200))

                                            # extract vocals
                                            vocals_estimate = mask_model.separate(mix_audio)
                                    
                                        from auralflow.models import SpectrogramNetVAE
                                            # initialize network
                                            mask_model = SpectrogramNetVAE(
                                                    num_fft_bins=1024,
                                                    num_frames=173,
                                                    hidden_channels=16,
                                                    recurrent_depth=2,
                                                    hidden_size=2048
                                            )

                                            # generate spectrogram data
                                            mix_spec = torch.rand((8, 1, 1024, 173))

                                            # estimate source mask
                                            source_mask = mask_model(mix_spec)
SWIFT DATA PROCESSING

Process Audio with a Single Tool

Customize the ins and outs of modifiable U-Nets — including LSTM networks and variational autoencoders — that learn time-frequency masks in the spectrogram domain.

Read About Data Transform  

Using audio transforms. 

                                from auralflow.utils.data_utils import AudioTransform


                                    # instantiate audio transform
                                    transform = AudioTransform(
                                        num_fft=1024,
                                        hop_length=768,
                                        window_size=1024,
                                         sample_rate=44100
                                    )

                                    # generate 2 sec audio sample
                                    mix_audio = torch.rand((16, 1, 88200))

                                    # audio to spectrogram
                                    mix_spec = transform.to_spectrogram(mix_audio)

                                    # estimate source mask
                                    source_mask = mask_model(mix_spec)

                                    # extract target source estimate
                                    target_spec_est = source_mask * mix_spec

                                    # transform spectrogram data back to audio
                                    target_audio_est = transform.to_audio(target_spec_est)
